data.title: Woody Allen
data.text:
politically incorrect

Bill Maher Calls Actors Who Won’t Work With Woody Allen “a Bunch of P-ssies”

In a new interview with Katie Couric, Maher said he doesn’t believe Allen molested his adopted daughter and touted his friendship with fellow “canceled” comedian Louis C.K.

venice 2023

Woody Allen, Roman Polanski’s New Films Meet Vastly Different Responses—But Similar Protests—In Venice

Polanski’s The Palace is borderline unwatchable; Allen’s Coup de Chance may be his best in years. But both are strikingly out of step with the conversations that surround them.

Film Festivals

Woody Allen Doesn’t Know What It Means to Be Canceled

As demonstrators gathered outside the premiere of his 50th feature film, Coup de Chance, the 87-year-old auteur received a warm welcome at a Venice Film Festival press conference: “I have been very, very lucky.”

a lido controversy

Venice Film Festival Director Defends Invites to Woody Allen, Roman Polanski, and Luc Besson

Films from a trio of auteurs previously accused of sexual misconduct are set to premiere at the prestigious fest. “I don’t see where the issue is,” Alberto Barbera says.

Memoir

Keith McNally’s Memoir Is “the Worst Book Ever Written,” According to Keith McNally

Simon & Schuster will publish the restauranteur’s highly anticipated book, I Regret Almost Everything, in November.

Cut!

Woody Allen Says Current Production Is His Last “In Principle”

The controversial 86-year-old writer-director will likely focus on a novel next.

insta low

Alec Baldwin Will Interview Woody Allen for Some Reason

“Let me preface this by stating that I have ZERO INTEREST in anyone’s judgments and sanctimonious posts here,” Baldwin wrote on Instagram, where the conversation is set to air live on Tuesday.

Speaking Out

Drew Barrymore Was “Gaslit” Into Working With Woody Allen, She Tells Dylan Farrow

“There was no higher career calling card than to work with Woody Allen,” the host said of her 1996 film, Everyone Says I Love You. “Then I had children, and it changed me.”

IN HINDSIGHT

“Predatory Men With a Taste for Teenagers” Joyce Maynard on the Chilling Parallels Between Woody Allen and J.D. Salinger

The novelist, who had a relationship with Salinger when she was 18 and he was 53, on the Allen v. Farrow documentary—and what happens when women tell the truth.

interviews

Woody Allen Denies Daughter Dylan Farrow’s Abuse Allegations on CBS Sunday Morning

It’s Allen’s first American television interview since 1992.

SCANDAL

Woody Allen, Dylan Farrow, and the Long, Uphill Road to a Reckoning

The author, whose groundbreaking reporting on Allen’s relationship with Mia Farrow and her children challenged the dominant media narrative, looks back on the Herculean effort required to call an iconic celebrity to account.

documented

Woody Allen, Soon-Yi Previn Deny Claims in Allen v. Farrow Docuseries

The disgraced filmmaker is once again denying claims that he abused his estranged daughter Dylan Farrow.

ALLEN V. FARROW

Why Mia Farrow Is Still Scared of Woody Allen

“A person who has no allegiance to truth will do anything,” says Farrow in HBO’s new docuseries Allen v. Farrow. “A person who will do anything is somebody to be scared of.”

Reviews

Allen v. Farrow: A Damning Investigation Into Allegations Against Woody Allen

The HBO docuseries leaves no stone unturned as it tries to untangle the story of Woody Allen, Mia Farrow, Dylan Farrow, and Soon-Yi Previn.

coming soon

Allen v. Farrow Will Tackle Woody Allen Sexual Abuse Allegations

See a trailer for the upcoming HBO docuseries, from The Hunting Ground filmmakers Kirby Dick and Amy Ziering.

EXCLUSIVE

Skyhorse Publishing’s House of Horrors

Skyhorse Publishing, literary home to Michael Cohen, Woody Allen, and Alan Dershowitz, has struggled with bigger problems than a roster of political unsavories. Interviews suggest a history of workplace toxicity and inappropriate behavior.
